title: Venus square Mars
summary: A frictional alignment between desire and action. Wants are clear, but timing, approach, or reciprocity may be misaligned. The task is to notice where pursuit and receptivity are out of sync.

meaning.headline: Desire has energy, but not perfect timing.

frames.text: Venus-Mars squares surface tension between attraction and execution, often showing where effort and receptivity don't match.
This aspect highlights friction around pacing-wanting something now versus creating the conditions for it to work.
Creative or relational chemistry may feel charged but harder to stabilize.
Irritation can arise when desire isn't met with the expected response.
This guarantees conflict, rejection, or sexual tension.

frictions: Creative blocks caused by forcing outcomes
opportunities: Clarifying what you actually want versus how you're pursuing it
Adjusting timing or approach to reduce resistance
Using tension as creative fuel rather than conflict

do: Notice whether effort is being met or resisted.
Channel desire into constructive or creative outlets.
Pause and ask what response you're actually seeking.
Let timing inform action, not just appetite.
avoid: Acting on impulse without reading context

reusable_lines.text: Desire needs timing as much as it needs energy.
Tension is information-adjust before you push.

forbidden_claims: Framing desire as obligation or entitlement
allowed_framing: Agency-forward framing: 'you can adjust how you pursue...'
Contextual framing: 'if attraction or creativity feels tense...'

sources: Venus-Mars square as desire/action tension archetype
